postsData.name:
Bora Ger
Bora Ger
postsData.content:
Agents will replace software. 

All of it!

Eventually.

↳ Agents are proactive,
↳ Agents learn and act autonomously,
↳ Agents use natural language,
↳ Agents adapt to your needs.

This seismic shift is predicted by Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella.

Agents are not apps.

They are intelligent assistants that understand context and act independently.
This is a complete paradigm shift.


Here are 5 key facts you should consider in planning your AI strategy:

1. Natural language will become the primary interface. Imagine talking to your devices and having them understand and act on your intentions. This is intuitive and transformative.

2. Agents will be personalized and adaptive. They will learn your habits and preferences, becoming more effective over time. This level of personalization is beyond current software.

3. Nadella's prediction affects all software categories. From productivity tools to entertainment, everything will change. This universal applicability is what makes it so disruptive.

4. The focus will shift from operating systems to agent orchestration. Traditional operating systems will become less relevant. New platforms will manage these intelligent agents, creating a new layer of computing infrastructure.

5. Large Language Models (LLMs) are driving this change.
Rapid advancements in AI, particularly LLMs, are enabling the natural language understanding and generation needed for effective agents.

This change is imminent.

Nadella predicts a five to ten-year timeframe for this agent revolution.
This is not a distant future concept but a near-term transformation.

And make no mistake. Microsoft is disrupting its legacy business model by taking on this journey seriously.


How about you?

️ Share if you believe AI is reshaping enterprise leadership.

 Guiding Fortune 500 leaders to unlock AI transformation. Follow me for executive insights and strategic playbooks. Join 31,000+ leaders turning disruption into advantage.

comments.commentText:
Reflecting on the rapid advancements in AI, I find myself torn about when AI agents might truly replace traditional software. On one hand, current tools like OpenAI’s Operator and Anthropic’s Claude Computer User, while innovative, still seem limited in their capabilities. This makes me think that a full transition is a long way off.

However, considering the significant leaps we’ve witnessed in just the past two years—such as the progression from GPT-2 to o1/o3 and the emergence of various other players like DeepSeek, Anthropic, Google, AWS, Microsoft, Apple, and NVIDIA pushing boundaries daily—it’s hard not to believe that this shift could happen sooner than we expect.

For now, AI agentic processes (not agents) are a reality and they can perform multi-step operations with impressive precision and scalability when given the right instructions and initial input. Yet, human supervision remains crucial. Thoughts?

Christian Iachini we will see a trajectory that goes from hype, to a hybrid world, to a increasingly agent dominated scenario. 

Nadalla talks 5 to 10 years. 

It comes down to several factors.

Data availability.
Stable ontologies.
Scalable and open architecture.
and...

leaders with the right mindset.
Amongst more variables.

We are still at the beginning.
However, if you look at Operator, when does it struggle?
Webpages made for humans.

As soon as agents access the web in a way that it is suitable for agents (aka agent-ready web offering), we look at a different speed.

Maybe...but agents are also not a cost efficient solution to many problems. It takes a lot of energy to run gen AI queries.

Some problems can be better solved with lower complexity.

And infrastructure does need some consistency to function.

And some business problems are better solved with a structured process flow. Because the underlying.

Maybe some of the times agents will just augment the software underneath(which implies software). Maybewill choose what software to use(which implies software)

So maybe its better to think of agents using software as tools, not replacing them entirely.

Andreas Borg I doubt software uses by agents will look like the tools we use today. 

As much as agents won’t have to work through website that were made for the human eye (and most still suck anyway)

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! The agent revolution is set to redefine how we interact with technology. Exciting times ahead for AI in enterprise! 🚀

postsData.name:
Neal Conlon
Neal Conlon
postsData.content:
Lots of people want to be speakers - And they want to speak in front of people that want to hear what they have to say.

Enter today’s uncomfortable challenge.

After teaching a college level curriculum where everyone is empowered and enamored by the journey, step in front of class after class of 16 year olds and watch them look at you with zero f*cks in their eyes.

It was a glorious battle. We usually only step into the arenas that we know we have a shot to win at.

Well today wasn’t about me. It was about planting seeds into the future.

To have that girl be acknowledged that yes she can be a doctor.

To the boy who wants to buy his parents a house and I said “how big will it be” and he said big!

To the girl who said she wants to be an entrepreneur- tell her she’s on the right path

To the boy who wants to take care of his parents when they get older - it’s easy when you have the right systems in place.

Today was not about me. It wasn’t about how uncomfortable it is to stand in front of a group of disassociated kids w one headphone in an ear or the kids who walked out when you asked them to stretch their mind for a minute.

It was for the kid who said “if you lost it all tomorrow what would you do to start over.

It was for the girl that said she wants to work in neonatal taking care of babies.

It was for all the kids that we can inspire and empower.

Press Forward >>>

PS: Oof

comments.commentText: Truth! I am teaching middle schoolers and judging a high school forensics tournament this week. They drive me crazy but I love their energy.

postsData.commentAdded: Inspiring to see you shift focus from your own discomfort to empowering the next generation! Your efforts will surely plant impactful seeds. 🌱👏

postsData.name:
Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor
Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor
postsData.content:
𝗜𝗳 𝗬𝗼𝘂 𝗖𝗮𝗻’𝘁 𝗦𝗲𝗲 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀, 
How Will You Achieve It?

Here’s how top leaders use visualization to stay ahead.

The best leaders don’t just plan.
They see success before it happens.

Visualization isn’t just a mindset trick.
It’s a proven tool that sharpens focus, boosts confidence, and enhances decision-making.

𝗛𝗲𝗿𝗲’𝘀 𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘁 𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝘁 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆:
1. Define Your Vision Clearly
A vague goal leads to vague results.
What does success look like for you?
Picture the details. The environment, the emotions, the impact.

2. Engage All Your Senses
Don’t just see it.
Hear it, feel it, experience it.
The more immersive your visualization, the stronger the mental imprint.

3. Align Your Actions with Your Vision
Visualization isn’t magic.
It works when paired with action.
Once you’ve envisioned success, identify one step you can take today.

4. Practice Daily for Reinforcement
Repetition strengthens neural pathways.
Make visualization a habit in the morning, before key meetings, or when setting goals.

5. Overcome Doubts with Mental Rehearsal
Your mind will resist change, but you can override doubts.
Mentally rehearse challenges and see yourself handling them with confidence.

Great leaders don’t just react.
They anticipate.

By mastering visualization, you’ll step into every opportunity with clarity and purpose.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗵𝗮𝗯𝗶𝘁 𝗼𝗿 𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘀𝗲𝘁 𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗳𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗵𝗮𝘀 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗯𝗶𝗴𝗴𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗴𝗼𝗮𝗹𝘀?

If this resonated with you, share it with your network. ️
Followfor more insights on Leadership and Startup Growth. ️

comments.commentText:

postsData.content:
A new efficient model of video image generation arrives: Magic 1-for-1

  Magic 1-For-1 is an advanced model for rapid video clip generation by optimizing memory and latency. It decomposes text-to-video conversion into two stages: text-to-image and image-to-video. The use of distillation and computational optimization techniques enables efficient and realistic production of short video clips. They will upload model weights within 3 days. Key points: Computational efficiency: reduces memory consumption and speeds up inference. Modular architecture: splits the process into two stages...

postsData.name:
Melissa Gaglione💫
Melissa Gaglione💫
postsData.content:
5 foundational tips for crushing B2B sales
(super easy) 

1. Master async communication You're not just selling in your time zone anymore.

Create momentum with scheduled content drops, video messages, and perfectly timed follow-ups.

Your deals should move while you sleep!

2. Build a video intro library Stop recording the same message 50 times.

Pre-record your best energy for common scenarios, then personalize the context.

Scale yourself without losing authenticity.

3. Live in your CRM

Don’t do dual data from CRM to spreadsheets.

And nobody likes to update CRM 5pm on a Friday.

I update my CRM all day long.

4. Nail your home office!

Look good feel good!

Clean background, good lighting, crisp audio!

5. Command virtual presence

Energy reads differently through screens.

Amp up your enthusiasm 20% And keep them engaged!


What are your foundational tips??

comments.commentText: Which standing desk would you reccomend purchasing?
Working on building my video library for intros!

postsData.commentAdded: Great tips! Mastering async communication is a game changer. Looking forward to hearing others foundational tips too! #B2BSales

postsData.name:
Inc Tank GTM
Inc Tank GTM
postsData.content:
Love this! 

The term "Failure is not an option" doesn't set the right expectation for anyone that's embarking on a journey of growth, creation or discovery.

Failure HAS TO BE BAKED into the grand calculus of any $UC$E$$ $TORY. If we look at the work we do as the GROSS, and consider the output our NET, then its reasonable to assert that FAILURE is the CO$T we pay to get to the margins that are our WIN$!

It's okay to fall, in fact it's part of every journey. It is vital that we remind ourselves of this daily. In almost every instance the peaks of success we see in others... Well, they are likely to be built on literal mountains of experimentation and failures that led to the shining summit they enjoy on the other side.

For GTM, it is a mountain, and acceptable failure is to be expected. At the same time, you can avoid avalanches, pitfalls, and traps along the way with the right Sherpas in place to help you pack your bags, plan the route and guide your ascent.

That's what Inc Tank GTM does for our clients.

Let's talk if you are about to set out, are on your way, or stuck on basecamp with no clear path to the summits you seek.
postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Embracing failure as part of the journey is crucial for growth and innovation. Excited to see how Inc Tank GTM guides others on their ascent!

postsData.name:
Jim Highsmith
Jim Highsmith
postsData.content: Are we paving cow paths once again? In the rush to overcome FOMO are we “doing the wrong things faster (DWTF)?”

comments.commentText:
Spot on! In an attempt to be additive to these cogent words, it seems worth remembering that deep learning LLMs, while reall good at fooling humans that they are human, are not “intelligent”. They are just another advance in information technology that has been advancing, sometimes in steps, sometimes in leaps, for many decades (some would argue centuries). What LLMs, transformers, and their chatty front ends are is quite remarkable, even if not intelligent. They represent a breakthrough in our ability to manage unstructured data, in much the same way that RDMBS, optimizers, and SQL were a breakthrough in our ability to manage structured data.

The force multiplier here is that there are orders of magnitude more unstructured than structured data in the world. And this is the opportunity open to all and the lens with which to precieve the myriad opportunities to rethink and reconstruct how we go about doing work in all fields and endeavors.

postsData.commentAdded: Great point! We need to prioritize the right strategies—lets focus on innovation, not just speed. Quality over quantity! 🚀

postsData.content:
Increasing conversion rate from 0.2 to 3.5% may seem impossible.

We recently worked with Dormie Workshop, a custom leather goods business specializing in branded golf club heads.

The previous developer left them with a website that wasn't optimized for mobile, missing critical funnel interactions and SEO.

So our team was brought in for a rescue mission to revamp their poorly built website.

In just 3 months, we were able to execute product discovery and build a bespoke design atop Shopify Plus, getting their online presence optimized for mobile, improving funnel interactions, and boosting SEO.

We worked alongside their marketing team led by Julian to ensure everything was aligned with their goals and vision. And the results speak for themselves (check the comments to see the new website)

A big thank you to our partners at GM2 for their collaboration and support throughout this project. We couldn't have done it without you!

If you're interested in learning more about this case study or how our team can help your business grow, please don't hesitate to reach out!

Learn more about our results here:

In the Pharma & Life Sciences industry, maintaining clinical data privacy and security is crucial. Our latest blog fromexplores the need for smart, configurable, automated, and customized solutions that comply with regulatory requirements like EMA Policy 0070, EMA (EU) CTR 536/2014, and Health Canada PRCI.

postsData.name:
Dr. Elwanda Bennett, MEDP, PMP
Dr. Elwanda Bennett, MEDP, PMP
postsData.content:
Authentic Leadership - Unlocking Opportunities & Building Success

Empowering Leaders | Driving Innovation | Creating Impact

postsData.name:
AIM
AIM
postsData.content:
Tata Communications and AI startup CoRover.ai have joined forces to introduce Sovereign AI solutions tailored for Indian enterprises and government bodies. This collaboration will leverage Tata Communications' Sovereign AI Cloud Platform alongside CoRover's conversational AI expertise, including its proprietary large language model,. With a strong emphasis on data sovereignty, cultural relevance, and regulatory compliance, the partnership aims to empower India’s digital ecosystem with secure and scalable AI-driven solutions.

, Vice President and Global Head of Cloud and Edge Business at Tata Communications, emphasized that this initiative marks a significant step in building an AI ecosystem that not only meets current demands but anticipates future needs., Founder and CEO of, highlighted CoRover’s commitment to pioneering India’s Sovereign AI landscape, ensuring that enterprises and government institutions can harness AI’s full potential while retaining control over their data and operations. The partnership will enable multilingual AI-powered applications, enhancing citizen services, e-governance, and enterprise automation.

The companies will also introduce ready-to-market AI products like CoRoAssist, CoRoGrievance, CoRoPayments, and CoRoAnalytics, facilitating seamless integration with CRM platforms and live agent interfaces. These solutions will drive innovation across digital public infrastructure, automating processes such as grievance management, onboarding, and payment processing. As India accelerates its AI adoption, this partnership sets the stage for a robust, future-ready AI ecosystem that prioritizes security, efficiency, and user engagement.

comments.commentText: It is so overwhelming to see the progress that we are making with AI !! However, a little scary as well since we have not enough knowledge about the security, AI laws and the unseen line of where it would take us all in future, which is not that far now!
Hope to see these AI driven platforms are getting adopted by State Governments too to provide services to the public

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting collaboration! This partnership will drive innovation and empower India’s digital landscape with secure, multilingual AI solutions. 🚀

postsData.name:
Adán De La Paz
Adán De La Paz
postsData.content:
Suspend judgement. Hold back on assumptions. Avoid jumping to conclusions.

The act of gathering information without immediately assigning a positive or negative connotation can be a tall order. It requires us to check our biases and remain neutral.

Several experienced coaches have shared with me a variation of what I’ve come to know as 𝘖𝘣𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘳 𝘌𝘷𝘢𝘭𝘶𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯.

This concept is about centering the client, putting them in the driver’s seat to address their needs while at the same time honoring their wholeness. This is particularly of immense value for marginalized individuals who seek a space that allows them to be raw and vulnerable.

An integrative approach to coaching means that the full client is able to show up—identity, culture, lived experience, values, behaviors, strengths, areas for growth, and more.

As I continue practicing this essential coaching method, here are five aspects I keep in mind:

• 𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗻 𝗼𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲. Observations are factual and based on what can be seen, heard, or measured. As a coach, I must focus on identifying patterns and underlying issues rather than diagnosing a single incident or performance.

• 𝗘𝗺𝗽𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆. Providing clear, specific observations helps clients dial in on the exact behaviors or actions being discussed. This clarity can lead to more effective communication, better understanding, and heightened self-awareness.

• 𝗔𝘀𝘀𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗼𝗿. When I as a coach pay greater attention to observations it also models for my clients the need to concentrate on specific behaviors rather than making generalized judgments. With this in mind, clients are more likely to self-generate action steps they can take to achieve their desired outcomes.

• 𝗘𝗻𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗹𝗳-𝗥𝗲𝗳𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. Another advantage to leading with observations is my ability as a coach to encourage clients to reflect on their own behaviors and come to their own conclusions about what needs to change. This fosters a sense of ownership, and the ability to stand in their personal power.

• 𝗕𝘂𝗶𝗹𝗱 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝘀𝘁. A coaching relationship built on observations fosters trust and openness. Clients are more likely to engage in honest and meaningful discussions about their development when I stay neutral. In turn, I’m able to create a safer and more supportive environment that encourages my clients to explore their behaviors and make improvements without feeling criticized.

Do any of the items shared resonate with you? Is there anything that comes to mind to expand this list?
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Emphasizing observation over evaluation truly empowers clients and fosters a safe coaching environment. Thank you for sharing!

postsData.name:
Patrick Spielmann
Patrick Spielmann
postsData.content:
This will be the MOST important cold email post you'll read for 2025, DO NOT skip it if you want your GTM strategy to PRODUCE:

80% of success with cold email is based on implementing the right strategy.

1️⃣ DELIVERABILITY
Decentralization is the TOP strategy you needed to deploy, yesterday.

→ Multiple inbox providers across Google/MS/Custom
→ Lookalike Domains: Remove company name from domains.
→ Digital SDRs: deidentify naming across accounts.
→ Do not try to “save money”, lower volume per email account.

2️⃣ LIST BUILDING
Tighten your lead groupings closer to relevance and intent. "Hit the bullseye"

→ Don’t use the “cheapest” data sources
→ Intent Signals: find creative “relevance” and "intent"
→ Lookalike Data: Find similar companies and capture demand
→ Standard Data: Scale only when you master the former.

3️⃣ COPYWRITING
The words you speak change your prospects mind. Stop sleeping on copy.

→ Google/MS inbox you based on content. Randomize it.
→ Use strong offers, social proof, lead magnets or ALL of them.
→ You can’t convert everyone on your list, so stop trying.
→ Niche your copy to one angle
→ Think: Get 10% of your list to reply 100% of the time.
→ Test. Test. Test. Test. Test. Test. Test. Test. Test. Test.

4️⃣ Keep going

Questions?
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Implementing these strategies will definitely elevate any GTM approach. Excited to see how cold email evolves in 2025! 🚀

postsData.name:
Vitorio Yosifov
Vitorio Yosifov
postsData.content:
“Our Data Is Perfect”: The Myth That Masks Data Leaks

Many industrial firms believe their data is top-notch—until they discover leaks, silos, and gaps that cripple decision-making. Simply gathering more data doesn’t help if it’s fragmented and unmonitored.

The Real Problem

️ Siloed OT & IT
When SCADA, MES, ERP, and IoT devices don’t share a common architecture, data gaps and inconsistencies go unnoticed—right up to the moment they cause downtime.

 Invisible Data Leaks
Machines can run unlogged or sensors silently drop data, which means your AI/ML models are training on incomplete information—and delivering limited or misleading insights.

 Reactive Decision-Making
Data remains stuck in silos or arrives too late, forcing teams into firefighting mode instead of strategic improvements.

Why It Matters?

-Missed Opportunities: Incomplete data can obscure game-changing optimization or cost-saving measures.

-Limited Agility: In a fast-paced market, real-time insights are crucial. Slow, siloed data hampers adaptability.

-Hidden Costs: Every minute lost to inconsistent or missing data is a drag on efficiency and profitability.

Have you uncovered “perfect data” that turned out not to be?
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Its a crucial reminder that true data integrity requires integration and oversight. Lets prioritize breaking down those silos!

postsData.content:
I hate to break it to you...but 9f you're a solopreneur, you probably don’t have a business.

You have a job with a really bad boss (yourself).

And worse? That boss...

• Doesn’t pay you on time
• Doesn’t give you benefits
• Gives you wildly inconsistent pay
• Expects you to work 60+ hours a week

You're stuck in the Feast & Famine cycle.

→ One month, you land a big client. Relief.
→ The next, nothing. Panic. Scramble. Freak out.
→ You take any work you can find, undercharge, and start over.

You work harder but never feel safer.

The problem? You don’t have a real business.

You have a collection of one-off projects duct-taped together with hope and exhaustion.

It’s why most solopreneurs eventually quit.

But there’s another way…

If you want to break out of this cycle, you need to think like a Solo CEO.

• A premium, easy to sell, offer
• A repeatable system for landing high-value clients
• A sales process that works even when you're not working

And I know that a lot of you WANT to learn but are scared of investing in a real program.

So I decided to put my HEART AND SOUL into a 100% free email course, breaking it all down.

Step by step...how to say goodbye to solopreneurship. And hello to Solo CEO.

The exact process that has helped my clients:

• 7x their rates
• Close 3 new clients in weeks
• Go from $500 projects to $20k retainers

It drops on Friday.

Get ready.




And if you're just too antsy, DM me SOLO and I'll make sure you get the link first

comments.commentText: What a compelling hook - evolving solopreneurs into solo CEOs.
Right, Leslie? That's my mission.

postsData.commentAdded: This is such a powerful perspective on solopreneurship! Excited for your free email course—can’t wait to learn more about transitioning to a Solo CEO! 🚀
